com.iha.emulator.control

Class AdapterController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iha.emulator.control.AdapterController

  • public class AdapterController
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates and controls adapter. Also contains all information gathered while simulation runs like unsent messages, scheduler for processing these messages, server with which should adapter communicate, list of created sensors, etc.
    Author:
    Filip Sutovsky

    • Property Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Enables adapter, so Scheduler can start to send messages to server.

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Disables adapter, so Scheduler is paused and no messages are sent to server.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String logMessage)
        Writes simple message to adapter's log.
        Parameters:
        logMessage - message to be written in log

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(OutMessage message)
        Adds new message for server to list of messages, so it can be sent to server. Also starts scheduler, if not running.
        Parameters:
        message - new message for server

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String logMessage,
                        org.dom4j.Document message,
                        SensorController senderController,
                        OutMessage.Type type)
        Creates new instance of OutMessage for server and adds it to list of messages ready to be sent. Also logs message to "To Be Sent" log and starts scheduler, if not running.
        Parameters:
        logMessage - message to be written to adapter's log
        message - message for server in Dom4j XML format
        senderController - sensor, that is sending this message
        type - message type

      • sendError

        public void sendError(java.lang.String message,
                      java.lang.Throwable t,
                      boolean terminate)
        Writes message to "Error" log.
        Parameters:
        message - message to be written to "Error" log
        t - exception that caused this error
        terminate - true if AdapterLogger should notify error handlers, false otherwise

      • changeValueOnSensor

        public void changeValueOnSensor(int sensorId,
                                java.util.ArrayList<SetNewValue> newValues)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Find sensor by it's ID and tries to change it's value/s. If sensor is not found or cannot apply new value, exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        sensorId - ID of a sensor, that is to change its value/s
        newValues - list of new values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - sensor ID not found or cannot apply new value/s

      • cleanSensor

        public void cleanSensor(int sensorId)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Deletes sensor (given by ID) from this adapter
        Parameters:
        sensorId - sensor to be deleted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - sensor ID not found or cannot delete it

      • deleteSensors

        public void deleteSensors(javafx.collections.ObservableList<SensorController> sensorControllers)
        Deletes sensors (given as list of sensor controllers) from this adapter.
        Parameters:
        sensorControllers - list of sensors to be deleted

      • deleteSensor

        public void deleteSensor(SensorController sensorController)
        Deletes sensor (given by sensor controller) from this adapter.
        Parameters:
        sensorController - sensor to be deleted

        public void deleteAll()
        Deletes all sensors on this adapter and after adapter itself is terminated.

        Deletes adapter.

      • clearResponseTracker

        public void clearResponseTracker()
        Clear responses from server

      • messageSuccessfullySent

        public void messageSuccessfullySent(OutMessage message)
        Notifies adapter, that message given as parameter was successfully sent. Adapter will remove this message from list of unsent messages and line in "To Be Sent" log is deleted.
        Parameters:
        message - message that was successfully sent

      • getNextMessage

        public OutMessage getNextMessage()
        Returns next unprocessed message
        Returns:
        message to be processed, null if there are no new messages

      • createAdapter

        public Adapter createAdapter(boolean status,
                             int id,
                             boolean registered,
                             Protocol.Version protocolVersion,
                             double firmware)
        Creates new instance of Adapter model from given parameters.
        Parameters:
        status - true if adapter is enabled, false otherwise
        id - adapter's ID
        registered - true if adapter is registered on server, false otherwise
        protocolVersion - version of protocol used to communicate with server
        firmware - adapter's firmware version
        Returns:
        new instance of adapter model

      • createAdapter

        public Adapter createAdapter(java.lang.String name,
                             boolean status,
                             int id,
                             boolean registered,
                             Protocol.Version protocolVersion,
                             double firmware)
        Creates new instance of Adapter model from given parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - adapter's name in emulator
        status - true if adapter is enabled, false otherwise
        id - adapter's ID
        registered - true if adapter is registered on server, false otherwise
        protocolVersion - version of protocol used to communicate with server
        firmware - adapter's firmware version
        Returns:
        new instance of adapter model

      • createServer

        public ServerController createServer(boolean conn,
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.String ip,
                                     int port,
                                     java.lang.String databaseName)
        Creates new instance of ServerController containing Server model with information given as parameters.
        Parameters:
        conn - connection status. True if connected, false otherwise.
        name - name of the server
        ip - IP address or hostname of server
        port - server port
        databaseName - name of database storing data
        Returns:
        new instance if server controller

      • createServer

        public ServerController createServer(Server server)
        Creates new instance of ServerController for Server model given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        server - server model
        Returns:
        new instance of server controller

      • createServerReceiver

        public ServerReceiver createServerReceiver()
        Creates new instance of ServerReceiver used to communicate with server by stable connection. Also bind ServerReceiver to adapter's status.
        Returns:
        new instance of server receiver

      • createSensorPanel

        public SensorPanelPresenter createSensorPanel(javafx.scene.Node container,
                                              java.lang.String headerHexColor,
                                              SensorIcon icon,
                                              SensorController sensorController)
                                       throws javafx.fxml.LoadException
        Creates new instance of SensorPanelPresenter as a GUI representation of sensor.
        Parameters:
        container - container for sensor panel
        headerHexColor - sensor's panel color
        icon - sensor's panel icon
        sensorController - sensor, for which is panel created
        Returns:
        new instance of panel for sensor
        Throws:
        javafx.fxml.LoadException - cannot load FXML file for SensorPanelPresenter

      • createSensor

        public SensorController createSensor(javafx.scene.Node container,
                                     java.lang.String headerHexColor,
                                     SensorIcon icon,
                                     javafx.collections.ObservableList<Value> values,
                                     boolean status,
                                     int id,
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     int battery,
                                     int signal,
                                     int refreshTime,
                                     Protocol protocol)
                              throws javafx.fxml.LoadException
        Creates new instance of SensorController from information given as parameters. Also creates GUI representation SensorPanelPresenter and model Sensor for new sensor.
        Parameters:
        container - container for sensor panel
        headerHexColor - sensor panel header color
        icon - sensor panel icon
        values - list of emulated values by new sensor
        status - connection to adapter status
        id - sensor ID
        name - sensor name
        battery - battery value
        signal - signal value
        refreshTime - refresh time in seconds
        protocol - instance of used protocol
        Returns:
        new instance of sensor controller with created panel placed in given container
        Throws:
        javafx.fxml.LoadException - cannot load sensor panel FXML file

      • createSensor

        public SensorController createSensor(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Value> values,
                                     boolean status,
                                     int id,
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     int battery,
                                     int signal,
                                     int refreshTime,
                                     Protocol protocol)
        Creates new instance of SensorController from information given as parameters and creates model Sensor for new sensor. Also sets offsets for given values, binds sensor's status to adapter's active sensors count, binds sensor's status to sensor's timer and binds sensor's status to adapter's status.
        Parameters:
        values - list of emulated values by new sensor
        status - connection to adapter status
        id - sensor ID
        name - sensor name
        battery - battery value
        signal - signal value
        refreshTime - refresh time in seconds
        protocol - instance of used protocol
        Returns:
        new instance of sensor controller

      • createScheduler

        public Scheduler createScheduler(Scheduler.Type type)
        Creates new instance of class implementing Scheduler from given type. Sets it's thread as daemon and starts it.
        Parameters:
        type - type of scheduler
        Returns:
        new instance of class implementing interface Scheduler

      • saveToXml

        public org.dom4j.Document saveToXml(org.dom4j.Document document)
        Creates Dom4j XML element in given document. Saves all information about adapter and its sensors needed for later loading of this adapter.
        Parameters:
        document - dom4j XML document
        Returns:
        XML document with information about adapter and its sensors

      • bindSchedulerProcess

        public void bindSchedulerProcess(Adapter adapter,
                                 Scheduler scheduler)
        Bind adapter status to scheduler's processing. If adapter is disabled, scheduler stops processing.
        Parameters:
        adapter - adapter to be bound
        scheduler - scheduler to be bound

      • bindRegisterMessage

        public void bindRegisterMessage()
        Binds sending of register message to adapter's status. If message hasn't been already sent when adapter is enabled, message is created and send for processing.

      • sendRegisterMessage

        public void sendRegisterMessage(AdapterController adapterController)
        If register message doesn't exist, creates register message and adds it to adapter's unsent messages queue
        Parameters:
        adapterController - adapter, for which is register message created

      • createRegisterMessage

        public OutMessage createRegisterMessage()
        Creates and returns register message
        Returns:
        register message

      • startScheduler

        public void startScheduler()
        If scheduler instance exists, it is set to start processing unsent messages.

      • stopScheduler

        public void stopScheduler()
        If scheduler instance exists, it is set to stop processing unsent messages.

      • createLog

        public void createLog(javafx.scene.control.TabPane tabPane)
        Crates new instance of AdapterLogger in container given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        tabPane - container for logger

      • removeSensorsAdaptersStatusListener

        private void removeSensorsAdaptersStatusListener(SensorController sensorController)
        Removes already created status listener from given sensor. Used when removing sensor, so application won't hold unnecessary information.
        Parameters:
        sensorController - sensor, for which should be status listener removed.

      • removeUnsentMessages

        private void removeUnsentMessages(SensorController sensorController)
        Removes all unsent messages by given sensor from adapter's unsent messages list. Used when removing sensor.
        Parameters:
        sensorController - sensor, for which should be unsent messages removed from list

        Returns:

        private boolean checkIfRegisterMessageExists()

        Returns:

        public void setTrackServerResponse(boolean b)
                            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Method sets, if ResponseTracker is enabled
        Parameters:
        b - true if response tracker should be enabled, false otheriwse
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if no scheduler with response tracker exists

                           throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sets if response tracker should remove response after it is logged by adapter's logger
        Parameters:
        b - true if responses should be dumped, false otheriwse
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if no scheduler with response tracker exists
